ProgramCreated(address,uint256,address,u.details: triggered when a program is created

ProgramEnabled(address,uint256,bool,uint.details: triggered when a program is enabled/disabled

ProgramTerminated(address,uint256,uint32.details: triggered when a program is terminated prematurely

ProviderJoined(address,uint256,address,u.details: triggered when a provider joins a program

ProviderLeft(address,uint256,address,uin.details: triggered when a provider leaves a program (even if partially)

RewardsClaimed(address,uint256,address,u.details: triggered when pending rewards are being claimed

RewardsStaked(address,uint256,address,ui.details: triggered when pending rewards are being staked

activeProgramId(address).details: returns the ID of the currently active program of a given pool returns 0 if no program is currently active for the given pool

claimRewards(uint256[],uint256).details: claims rewards and returns the claimed reward amount

constructor.details: a "virtual" constructor that is only used to set immutable state variables

createProgram(address,address,uint256,ui.details: creates a program for a pool and returns its ID requirements: - the caller must be the admin of the contract - the pool must not have an active program - if the rewards token isn't the BNT token, then the rewards must have been deposited to the rewards vault

depositAndJoin(uint256,uint256).details: deposits and adds provider's stake to the program requirements: - the caller must have approved the network contract to transfer the tokens its behalf (ETH is handled separately)

depositAndJoinPermitted(uint256,uint256,.details: deposits and adds provider's stake to the program by providing an EIP712 typed signature for an EIP2612 permit request requirements: - the caller must have specified a valid and unused EIP712 typed signature

enableProgram(uint256,bool).details: enables or disables a program requirements: - the caller must be the admin of the contract

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

initialize().details: fully initializes the contract and its parents

isProgramActive(uint256).details: returns whether the specified program is active

isProgramEnabled(uint256).details: returns whether the specified program is enabled

join(uint256,uint256).details: adds a provider to the program requirements: - the caller must have approved the contract to transfer pool tokens on its behalf

joinPermitted(uint256,uint256,uint256,ui.details: adds provider's stake to the program by providing an EIP712 typed signature for an EIP2612 permit request requirements: - the caller must have specified a valid and unused EIP712 typed signature

leave(uint256,uint256).details: removes (some of) provider's stake from the program requirements: - the caller must have specified a valid and unused EIP712 typed signature

pendingRewards(address,uint256[]).details: returns provider's pending rewards requirements: - the specified program ids array needs to consist from unique and existing program ids with the same reward   token

programStake(uint256).details: returns the total staked amount in a specific program

programs(uint256[]).details: returns program data for each specified program id

providerProgramIds(address).details: returns all the program ids that the provider participates in

providerStake(address,uint256).details: returns the total staked amount of a specific provider in a specific program

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

stakeRewards(uint256[],uint256).details: claims and stake rewards and returns the claimed reward amount and the received pool token amount requirements: - the specified program ids array needs to consist from unique and existing program ids with the same reward   token - the rewards token must have been whitelisted with an existing pool

terminateProgram(uint256).details: terminates a rewards program requirements: - the caller must be the admin of the contract - the program must exist and be the active program for its pool
